channel.description: The AIDS infection rate among young Southerly Africans appears to have dipped somewhat and overall an infection rates appear to be stabilizing, according to figures launched by the health ministry Mon.Health Minister Manto Tshabalala-Msimang said a report showed that the issue rate for pregnant mothers under the age of Twenty had decreased through 18 to 15.4 % between 1998 along with 2000.Stigma from the disease runs loaded with South Africa, however, and lots of people refuse to take HIV tests, making an accurate count tough.Infection rates among pregnant women are used as being a gauge because they are tested for HIV once they come to the hospital to present birth.Some Four.7 million To the south Africans, one in nine, tend to be HIV positive, lots more people than any other nation in the world.Tshabalala-Msimang, who introduced a national study on HIV, said that your figure of 4.6 million people has always been basically stable since 2000.The health reverend credited the national AIDS-prevention program for lowering the number of new AIDS cases, but critics say that until recently the actual government's policies distracted efforts to fight the disease's spread.Inside April, the government declared a more aggressive strategy toward tackling the pandemic.But Monday's information was not all stimulating. The prevalence associated with HIV among women over 30 gave the impression to rise slightly.Of females between the ages of 30 as well as 34, the infection charge stood at 25.6 percent last year compared with 23.3 percent inside 2000. The increase was more dramatic in ladies between the ages of 35 as well as 39, of whom Nineteen.3 percent were afflicted in 2001, upwards from 15.8 percent in The year 2000, the study said.
